info.title: Azure AI Health Insights
info.description: Azure AI Health Insights provides an API that serves insight models, specific for Health & Life Sciences, that perform analysis and provide inferences to be used by a human.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example: https://westus2.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

AzureKey.description: The secret key for your Azure Cognitive Services subscription.
AzureKey.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key

get.description: Gets the status and details of the Radiology Insights job.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the job.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

x-ms-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, server-generated string identifier for the request.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

x-ms-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, server-generated string identifier for the request.

put.description: Creates a Radiology Insights job with the given request body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the job.

Operation-Location.description: The location for monitoring the operation state.

x-ms-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, server-generated string identifier for the request.

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created as a result.

Operation-Location.description: The location for monitoring the operation state.

x-ms-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, server-generated string identifier for the request.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

x-ms-request-id.description: An opaque, globally-unique, server-generated string identifier for the request.

AgeMismatchInference.description: A notification for age mismatch is displayed when the age mentioned in a document for a specific patient does not match the age specified in the patient information.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

ClinicalDocumentType.description: The type of the clinical document.

CompleteOrderDiscrepancyInference.description: A complete order discrepancy is shown when one or more body parts and/or measurements that should be in the document (because there is a complete order) are not present.

orderType.description: Order type : CPT ultrasound complete code for abdomen, retroperitoneal, pelvis or breast.

missingBodyParts.description: List of missing body parts required by a complete order : SNOMED CT codes.

missingBodyPartMeasurements.description: List of missing body parts that require measurement by a complete order : SNOMED CT codes.

CriticalResult.description: Critical Result consists of two properties.

finding.description: Finding linked to the critical result.

CriticalResultInference.description: Critical results refer to findings of utmost importance that may require timely attention due to their potential impact on patient care.

result.description: The complete Critical Result, as outlined below, will be reused for the recommendation.

orderedProcedures.description: List of procedure information associated with the document.

encounterId.description: Reference to the encounter associated with the document.

fullName.description: Text representation of the full name

DocumentContent.description: The content of the patient document.

sourceType.description:
The type of the content's source.
In case the source type is 'inline', the content is given as a string (for instance, text).
In case the source type is 'reference', the content is given as a URI.

value.description: The content of the document, given either inline (as a string) or as a reference (URI).

DocumentContentSourceType.description:
The type of the content's source.
In case the source type is 'inline', the content is given as a string (for instance, text).
In case the source type is 'reference', the content is given as a URI.

values.name: Inline
values.description: The content is given as a string (for instance, text).

values.name: Reference
values.description: The content is given as a URI.

DocumentType.description: The type of the patient document, such as 'note' (text document) or 'fhirBundle' (FHIR JSON document).

EncounterClass.description: Known values codes that can be used to indicate the class of encounter (TODO://Based on FHIR value set--http://....).

values.name: InPatient
values.description: A patient encounter where a patient is admitted by a hospital or equivalent facility, assigned to a location where patients generally stay at least overnight and provided with room, board, and continuous nursing service.

values.name: Ambulatory
values.description: The term ambulatory usually implies that the patient has come to the location and is not assigned to a bed. Sometimes referred to as an outpatient encounter.

values.name: Observation
values.description: An encounter where the patient usually will start in different encounter, such as one in the emergency department but then transition to this type of encounter because they require a significant period of treatment and monitoring to determine whether or not their condition warrants an inpatient admission or discharge.

values.name: Emergency
values.description: A patient encounter that takes place at a dedicated healthcare service delivery location where the patient receives immediate evaluation and treatment, provided until the patient can be discharged or responsibility for the patient's care is transferred elsewhere (for example, the patient could be admitted as an inpatient or transferred to another facility.

values.name: Virtual
values.description: A patient encounter where the patient is not physically present for the encounter, such as in a telehealth encounter, phone call, or electronic communication.

values.name: HealthHome
values.description: Healthcare encounter that takes place in the residence of the patient or a designee

Fhir.R4.Annotation.description:
A text note which also  contains information about who made the statement and when
Based on [FHIR Annotation](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#Annotation)

Fhir.R4.CodeableConcept.description:
Concept - reference to a terminology or just text
Based on [FHIR CodeableConcept](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#CodeableConcept)

coding.description: Code defined by a terminology system

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

Fhir.R4.Coding.description:
A Coding is a representation of a defined concept using a symbol from a defined "code system".
Based on [FHIR Coding](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#Coding)

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

Fhir.R4.Condition.description:
Detailed information about conditions, problems or diagnoses
Based on [FHIR Condition](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/condition.html)

clinicalStatus.description: active | recurrence | relapse | inactive | remission | resolved

verificationStatus.description: unconfirmed | provisional | differential | confirmed | refuted | entered-in-error

code.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis

onsetDateTime.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age

onsetAge.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age

onsetPeriod.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age

onsetRange.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age

onsetString.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age

Fhir.R4.ConditionStage.description:
Stage/grade, usually assessed formally
Based on [FHIR Condition.Stage](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/condition.html)

name.description: Name of an individual to contact

telecom.description: Contact details for individual or organization

Fhir.R4.ContactPoint.description:
Details for all kinds of technology mediated contact points for a person or organization, including telephone, email, etc.
See https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#ContactPoint

system.description: phone | fax | email | pager | url | sms | other

use.description: home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point

rank.description: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)

period.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use

Fhir.R4.DomainResource.description:
A resource with narrative, extensions, and contained resources
Based on [FHIR DomainResource](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/domainresource.html)

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

Fhir.R4.Element.description:
The base definition for all elements contained inside a resource.
Based on [FHIR Element](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/element.html)

Fhir.R4.Extension.description:
Base for all elements
Based on [FHIR Element](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#Element)

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

Fhir.R4.Identifier.description:
An identifier intended for computation
Based on [FHIR Identifier](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/identifier.html)

use.description: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

period.description: Time period when id is/was valid for use

assigner.description: Organization that issued id (may be just text)

Fhir.R4.Meta.description:
Metadata about a resource
Based on [FHIR Meta](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#Meta)

versionId.description: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

source.description: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of Provenance information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.

profile.description: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/structuredefinition.html) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).

security.description: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.

tag.description: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.

Fhir.R4.Narrative.description:
Any resource that is a [DomainResource](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/domainresource.html) may include a human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Based on [FHIR Narrative](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/narrative.html#Narrative)

Fhir.R4.Observation.description:
Detailed information about observations
Based on [FHIR Observation](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html)

subject.description: Who and/or what the observation is about

encounter.description: Healthcare event during which this observation is made

issued.description: Date/Time this version was made available

hasMember.description: Related resource that belongs to the Observation group

derivedFrom.description: Related measurements the observation is made from

dataAbsentReason.description: Why the component result is missing

referenceRange.description: Provides guide for interpretation of component result

Fhir.R4.ObservationReferenceRange.description:
Provides guide for interpretation of component result
Based on [FHIR Observation.referenceRange](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/observation.html)

text.description: Text based reference range in an observation

values.name: Registered
values.description: The existence of the observation is registered, but there is no result yet available.

values.name: Preliminary
values.description: This is an initial or interim observation: data may be incomplete or unverified.

values.name: Final
values.description: The observation is complete and verified by an authorized person.

values.name: Amended
values.description: Subsequent to being Final, the observation has been modified subsequent.  This includes updates/new information and corrections.

values.name: Corrected
values.description: Subsequent to being Final, the observation has been modified to correct an error in the test result.

values.name: Cancelled
values.description: The observation is unavailable because the measurement was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").

values.name: EnteredInError
values.description: The observation has been withdrawn following previous final release.

values.name: Unknown
values.description: The observation status is unknown.  Note that "unknown" is a value of last resort and every attempt should be made to provide a meaningful value other than "unknown".

Fhir.R4.Period.description:
A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time
Based on [FHIR Period](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#Period)

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

Fhir.R4.Quantity.description:
A measured or measurable amount
Based on [FHIR Quantity](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#Quantity)

system.description: System that defines coded unit form

Fhir.R4.Range.description:
A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit
Based on [FHIR Range](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#Range)

Fhir.R4.Ratio.description:
A ratio of two Quantity values - a numerator and a denominator
Based on [FHIR Ratio](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#Ratio)

Fhir.R4.Reference.description:
A reference from one resource to another
Based on [FHIR Reference](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html)

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

Fhir.R4.ResearchStudy.description:
Detailed information about Research Study
Based on [FHIR ResearchStudy](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/researchstudy.html)

status.description: active | administratively-completed | approved | closed-to-accrual | closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | completed | disapproved | in-review | temporarily-closed-to-accrual | temporarily-closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | withdrawn

primaryPurposeType.description: treatment | prevention | diagnostic | supportive-care | screening | health-services-research | basic-science | device-feasibility

phase.description: n-a | early-phase-1 | phase-1 | phase-1-phase-2 | phase-2 | phase-2-phase-3 | phase-3 | phase-4

keyword.description: Used to search for the study

period.description: When the study began and ended

sponsor.description: Organization that initiates and is legally responsible for the study

principalInvestigator.description: Researcher who oversees multiple aspects of the study

site.description: Facility where study activities are conducted

arm.description: Defined path through the study for a subject

values.name: Active
values.description: The study is open for accrual.

values.name: AdministrativelyCompleted
values.description: Study is completed prematurely and will not resume; patients are no longer examined nor treated.

values.name: Approved
values.description: Protocol is approved by the review board.

values.name: ClosedToAccrual
values.description: Study is closed for accrual; patients can be examined and treated.

values.name: ClosedToAccrualAndIntervention
values.description: The study is closed to accrual and intervention, i.e. the study is closed to enrollment, all study subjects have completed treatment or intervention but are still being followed according to the primary objective of the study.

values.name: Completed
values.description: Study is closed to accrual and intervention, i.e. the study is closed to enrollment, all study subjects have completed treatment or intervention but are still being followed according to the primary objective of the study.

values.name: Disapproved
values.description: Protocol was disapproved by the review board.

values.name: InReview
values.description: Protocol is submitted to the review board for approval.

values.name: TemporarilyClosedToAccrual
values.description: The study is temporarily closed to accrual; a pause in accrual while study is reviewed, but is expected to resume.

values.name: TemporarilyClosedToAccrualAndIntervention
values.description: Study is temporarily closed for accrual; can be potentially resumed in the future

values.name: Withdrawn
values.description: Protocol was withdrawn by the lead organization.

Fhir.R4.Resource.description:
Resource is the ancestor of DomainResource from which most resources are derived. Bundle, Parameters, and Binary extend Resource directly.
Based on [FHIR Resource](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/r4/resource.html

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

Fhir.R4.SampledData.description:
A series of measurements taken by a device
Based on [FHIR SampledData](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/datatypes.html#SampledData)

factor.description: Multiply data by this before adding to origin

dimensions.description: Number of sample points at each time point

FindingInference.description: Findings in a radiology report typically describe abnormalities, lesions, or other notable observations related to the anatomy or pathology of the imaged area.

finding.description: Finding data : contains extensions, fields and components linked with the finding.

provideFocusedSentenceEvidence.description: If this is true, provide the sentence that contains the first token of the finding's clinical indicator (i.e. the medical problem), if there is one. This sentence is provided as an extension with url 'ci_sentence', next to the token evidence. Default is false.

FollowupCommunicationInference.description: Follow-up communication involves the exchange of important information, recommendations, or updates between radiologists and other healthcare professionals involved in a patient's care.

FollowupRecommendationInference.description: Follow-up recommendations offer guidance to healthcare providers on managing and monitoring patients based on the findings of imaging studies.

effectiveAt.description: Date and time are displayed when the procedure is recommended to be done at a specific point in time.

effectivePeriod.description: The period is shown if a specific period is mentioned, with a start and end date-time.

isConditional.description: The conditional value indicates whether or not the sentence containing the recommendation includes a conditional statement. Keywords for conditional statements include 'if', 'when', 'unless', and so on.

isOption.description: The option value indicates whether or not the sentence containing the recommendation includes an optional statement. Keywords for optional statements include 'recommend', 'consider', and so on.

isGuideline.description: The guideline value indicates whether or not the recommendation is part of a guideline section that compiles all recommendations applicable to various findings.

isHedging.description: Hedging refers to ambiguous, vague or imprecise language within the sentence of the recommendation. Keywords for hedging are 'can be','may be',and so on.

recommendedProcedure.description: The procedure recommendation can be a generic procedure or an imaging procedure.

includeRecommendationsWithNoSpecifiedMod.description: Include/Exclude follow-up recommendations without a specific radiology procedure. Default is false.

includeRecommendationsInReferences.description: Include/Exclude follow-up recommendations in references to a guideline or article. Default is false.

provideFocusedSentenceEvidence.description: If this is true, provide one or more sentences as evidence for the recommendation, next to the token evidence. The start and end positions of these sentences will be put in an extension with url 'modality_sentences'. Default is false.

description.description: Procedure description : MANAGEMENT PROCEDURE (PROCEDURE) or CONSULTATION (PROCEDURE) based on SNOMED CT.

JobStatus.description: The status of the processing job.

LateralityDiscrepancyInference.description: A laterality mismatch occurs when there is a discrepancy between the clinical documentation and the ordered procedure (orderLateralityMismatch), a contradiction within the clinical document (textLateralityContradiction), or when no laterality is mentioned (textLateralityMissing).

lateralityIndication.description: Laterality indication : SNOMED CT code for laterality qualifier value.

LimitedOrderDiscrepancyInference.description: A limited order discrepancy occurs when there is a limited order, but all body parts and measurements that are needed for a complete order are present in the document.

orderType.description: Order type : CPT ultrasound complete code for abdomen, retroperitoneal, pelvis or breast.

presentBodyParts.description: List of body parts found in the document : SNOMED CT codes.

presentBodyPartMeasurements.description: List of body parts that are measured according to the document : SNOMED CT codes.

ModelVersion.description: The version of the model used for inference, expressed as the model date.

PatientDetails.description: Patient structured information, including demographics and known structured clinical information.

clinicalInfo.description: Known clinical information for the patient, structured.

PatientDocument.description: A clinical document related to a patient. Document here is in the wide sense - not just a text document (note).

type.description: The type of the patient document, such as 'note' (text document) or 'fhirBundle' (FHIR JSON document).

clinicalType.description: The type of the clinical document.

id.description: A given identifier for the document. Has to be unique across all documents for a single patient.

language.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 representation of the language of the document.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the document was created.

content.description: The content of the patient document.

period.description:
Time period of the visit.
In case of admission, use timePeriod.start to indicate the admission time and timePeriod.end to indicate the discharge time.

PatientRecord.description: A patient record, including their clinical information and data.

id.description: A given identifier for the patient. Has to be unique across all patients in a single request.

details.description: Patient structured information, including demographics and known structured clinical information.

patientDocuments.description: Patient unstructured clinical data, given as documents.

ProcedureRecommendation.description: The procedure recommendation can be a generic procedure or an imaging procedure.

RadiologyCodeWithTypes.description: Radiology code with types : used in imaging procedure recommendation for contrast and view.

code.description: The SNOMED CT code indicates whether imaging was conducted with or without contrast in the case of contrast, and in the case of views, it denotes the number of views.

types.description: The collection of types will indicate the contrast substance used in the case of contrast and, in the case of views, it will specify the types of views, such as lateral and frontal, etc.

RadiologyInsightsData.description: Contains the list of patients, and configuration data.

patients.description: The list of patients, including their clinical information and data.

configuration.description: Configuration affecting the Radiology Insights model's inference.

RadiologyInsightsInference.description:
An inference made by the Radiology Insights model regarding a patient.
  - AgeMismatch
  - SexMismatch
  - LateralityDiscrepancy
  - CompleteOrderDiscrepancy
  - LimitedOrderDiscrepancy
  - Finding
  - CriticalResult
  - FollowupRecommendation
  - RadiologyProcedure
  - FollowupCommunication

RadiologyInsightsInferenceOptions.description: Options regarding follow up recommendation inferences and finding inferences.

RadiologyInsightsInferenceResult.description: The inference results for the Radiology Insights request. If field 'status' has value 'succeeded', then field 'result' will contain an instance of RadiologyInsightsInferenceResult.

patientResults.description: Results for the patients given in the request.

modelVersion.description: The version of the model used for inference, expressed as the model date.

RadiologyInsightsJob.description: Response for the Radiology Insights request.

jobData.description: The request data for the operation.

id.description: The unique ID of the job.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the processing job was created.

expiresAt.description: The date and time when the processing job is set to expire.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the processing job was last updated.

error.description: Error object that describes the error when status is "Failed".

RadiologyInsightsModelConfiguration.description: Configuration affecting the Radiology Insights model's inference.

verbose.description: An indication whether the model should produce verbose output.

includeEvidence.description: An indication whether the model's output should include evidence for the inferences.

inferenceTypes.description: This is a list of inference types to be inferred for the current request. It could be used if only part of the Radiology Insights inferences are required. If this list is omitted or empty, the model will return all the inference types.

inferenceOptions.description: Options regarding follow up recommendation inferences and finding inferences.

locale.description: Local for the model to use. If not specified, the model will use the default locale.

RadiologyInsightsPatientResult.description: Results of the model's work for a single patient.

patientId.description: Identifier given for the patient in the request.

inferences.description: The model's inferences for the given patient.

RadiologyProcedureInference.description: Radiology procedures are the specific imaging studies or examinations ordered for the patient, extracted from the document information and text.

orderedProcedure.description: Ordered procedure information from the document information or text.

criticalFinding.description: Critical result linked to a recommendation.

SexMismatchInference.description: A notification for a sex mismatch is displayed when the gender, personal pronouns, gender-related body parts, or gender-related procedures mentioned in a patient's clinical document are either inconsistent or do not match the gender specified in the patient information.

sexIndication.description: Sex indication : SNOMED CT code for gender finding.

SpecialtyType.description: Known values codes that can be used to indicate the type of the Specialty.

TimePeriod.description: A duration of time during which an event is happening

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

Azure.Core.ExpandQueryParameter.name: expand
Azure.Core.ExpandQueryParameter.description: Expand the indicated resources into the response.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.
